Package com.ptc.core.query.report.bom.common

This package provides BOM (bill of materials) reporting capabilities via BOMReportHelper.  These reports are produced as XML and then optionally styled with XSLT.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BOMReportConstants
    Constants for use with BOMReportHelper.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BOMReportHelper
    Helper class to hide remote forwarding to BOMReportService.

Package com.ptc.core.query.report.bom.common Description

This package provides BOM (bill of materials) reporting capabilities via BOMReportHelper.  These reports are produced as XML and then optionally styled with XSLT.

Unless otherwise noted, the reports produced by BOMReportHelper can be extended by passing names of ReportTemplates (and/or the classnames of implementations of the Reportable interface) to run against the BOM data nodes.  The results of these reports are then combined with the BOM results to form the resulting XML stream.  The supplied XSLT integrates the BOM and other report results into a unified whole.

How To:

How to use BOMReportHelper

BOMReportHelper is a supported API and can be called from client or server code.

JSP pages which translate HTTP request parameters and/or servlet request attributes into BOMReportHelper method calls and arguments are provided in {Windchill codebase}/wtcore/jsp/report/bom.  These JSP files contain comments explaining their supported inputs and should be sufficiently general as to not require any changes.  [If the request parameter names are not to one's liking or a servlet request attribute must be provided, then use a server-side forward to accomplish these ends.]

How to select an XSLT stylesheet

The bomReport.jsp and consolidatedBOMReport.jsp JSP pages in {Windchill codebase}/wtcore/jsp/report/bom currently default to {Windchill codebase}/com/ptc/core/query/report/bom/common/bomReportHTML.xsl a reasonable, general purpose stylesheet for these BOM reports.  Other XSLT stylesheets may be specified via the document method arguments in BOMReportHelper or HTTP request parameters in the JSP pages.  In all cases relative URLs are interpretted as 'file:' URLs relative to the Windchill server codebase.

There are other stylesheets in {Windchill codebase}/com/ptc/core/query/report/bom/common which are better suited to particular applications:
 

Stylesheet Purpose
bomReportWithTPLinks.xsl Extends bomReportHTML.xsl to generate hyperlinks to Windchill template processor properties pages for objects where possible.
supplyLinkBomReport.xsl Extends bomReportHTML.xsl to generate hyperlinks to SupplyLink DCA properties pages for part iterations.

Using a ReportTemplate with BOMReportHelper

As previously mentioned, BOMReportHelper can execute a list of ReportTemplates provided by the caller against the nodes of a BOM.  This is done by the caller providing a list of the names of the ReportTemplates to execute and a list of the type codes of these reports.  The types are as defined by BOMReportConstants and let BOMReportHelper know which type of information from the BOM to provide to each report.  To operate properly, the given ReportTemplate must also accept this data via a list input parameter whose name is that expected by BOMReportHelper for the given type.  The expected parameter names are also defined by BOMReportConstants.  The table below summarizes this information for quick reference.
 
Report against Type code Report Receives Via Report Parameter Named
Part Masters 0 List of part master ids Master Ids
Part Iterations 1 List of part iteration ids Iteration Ids
Part Versions 2 List of part branch ids Branch Ids
Part Usage Links 3 List of part usage link ids Usage Ids

Thus all ReportTemplates specified when calling BOMReportHelper methods receive a list of object or version ids of some form or another -- which are usually used in an IN clause in the report criteria.

In order for the provided XSLT stylesheet to correlate the ReportTemplate results with the BOM nodes, the first ReportTemplate result column must contain the ids of the correct form for the specified report type code.  The remaining columns will appear in the HTML output.

Note that if a column alias/heading is found in the bomReportRB_*.xml XML translation resource bundle for the given locale, the heading will be translated, so place entries in these files if heading translation is desired.  [The format of these bundles is simple: the element name is the key and the element contents are the translation.  The pattern should be clear from the file contents thus far.]

Using a Reportable implementation with BOMReportHelper

In cases where a QueryBuilder ReportTemplate is insufficient, one can provide an implementation of the com.ptc.core.query.report.bom.server.Reportable interface that produces the desired results instead.  In this case the classname of the Reportable implementation should be provided instead of the ReportTemplate name.  In other respects, however, Reportable implementations are treated in the same manner described for ReportTemplates above, and they should follow the same rules.
